To find the percentage increase, we can take the natural logarithm (base e) of both sides of the equation 1 * (price increase) = 1 * (1 + 4135596%), which results in the formula ln(price increase) = ln(1 + 4135596%) => price increase = e^(ln(1+4135596%)).
